availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William G Stuart (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of James Stuart and Susan Stuart. Married to Mary G. Thomson in Clark County, Kentucky, on October 27, 1859. Married to Lizzie A. Stuart. Father of George T. Stuart and Nannie E. Stuart. Owned Robert Stewart in Clark County from 1859 to September 23, 1864. Farmer in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Clark County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 911.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 324A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Flemingsburg, p. 383A.
Compiled Military Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in United States Colored Troops: 1st through 5th United States Colored Cavalry, 5th Massachusetts Cavalry (Colored), 6th United States Colored Cavalry, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M1817, Roll 0105.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Clark County, KY, July 1863, p. 23.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clark County Marriages, Film 001943687.
Lyndon Comstock, Before Abolition: African Americans in Early Clark County, Kentucky (Lexington, KY: Lyndon Comstock, 2017): p. 676.
